intro: Metrosideros spectabilis, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows up to 6 meters tall. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its bark is smooth and reddish-brown. The species is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in areas with high humidity and salt spray.
